705347f-a.folder: Lafayette Avenue & Clermont Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
705347f-a.text:
Lafayette Ave., at the N.E. corner of Clermont Ave. A view of Vernon Bros. Town House, now occupied by the Masonic Temple.
1920.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

703634f-a.folder: Clermont Avenue & Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
703634f-a.text:
Clermont Ave., east side, south from Lafayette St., towards Greene Ave. The view shows the upper half of the tower
of the Episcopal Church of the Messiah.
August 2, 1927.
P.L.Sperr.
Neg # 4122

703632f-a.folder: Clermont Avenue & Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
703632f-a.text:
Clermont Avenue, south from Lafayette Avenue, showing St. John's Roman Catholic Chapel (white building) and the Church of the
Messiah (Cove-shanec Steeple).
P. L. Sperr  June 21, 1941
[errors in original text corrected]

705348f-a.folder: Lafayette Avenue & Clermont Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
705348f-a.text:
Lafayette Avenue, at the northwest corner of Clermont Avenue.
P. L. Sperr  September 19, 1941

703633f-a.folder: Clermont Avenue & Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
703633f-a.text:
317 Clermont Ave., at the N.E. corner of Lafayette Ave., showing the Masonic Temple.
August 2, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
